csvColumnsLabel.message: Date;Url;Request number;Size(kb);Dom size;Greenhouse Gases Emission (gCO2e);Water consumption;ecoIndex;Grade

deleteAllConfirmMessage.message: Do you really want to delete all history ?

menuText.message: GreenIT Analysis is install in your browser and accessible via the devtool panel (F12)
menuText.description: Text when you click on the plugin's icone

menuMoreInformation.description: Link for help in the menu frame

rule_AddExpiresOrCacheControlHeaders_Det.message: The Expires and Cache-Control headers determine how long a browser should keep a resource in its cache. You should therefore use them, and configure them correctly for CSS style sheets, JavaScript scripts and images. Ideally, these elements should be kept as long as possible so that the browser does not request them again from the server. This saves HTTP requests, bandwidth and CPU power server-side.
$resource$KB has no Expires or Cache-Control header
rule_AddExpiresOrCacheControlHeaders_Det.description: KB has no Expires or Cache-Control header

rule_CompressHttp_DetailDescription.message: You can compress the content of HTML pages to minimize bandwidth consumption between the client and the server. All modern browsers (for smartphones, tablets, notebook and desktop computers) accept HTML compressed via gzip or Deflate. The easiest way to do so is to configure the web server so that it compresses the HTML data stream, either on-the-fly or automatically, as it leaves the server. This practice (on-the-fly compression) is only beneficial for a HTML data stream as it is constantly evolving. When possible, we recommend that you manually compress static resources (e.g. CSS and JavaScript libraries) all in one go.

rule_DomainsNumber_DetailDescription.message: When a website or online service hosts a web page’s components across several domains, the browser has to establish an HTTP connection with every single one. Once the HTML page has been retrieved, the browser calls the sources as it traverses the DOM (Document Object Model). Some resources are essential for the page to work. If they are hosted on another domain which is slow, it may increase the page’s render time. You should therefore, when possible, group all resources on a single domain. The only exception to this is for static resources (style sheets, images, etc.), which should be hosted on a separate domain to avoid sending one or multiple cookies for each browser GET HTTP request. This reduces response time and unnecessary bandwidth consumption.

rule_DontResizeImageInBrowser.description: Do not resize image in browser

rule_DontResizeImageInBrowser_DetailDesc.message: Do not resize images using HTML height and width attributes. Doing so sends images in their original size, wasting bandwidth and CPU power. A PNG-24 350 x 300 px image is 41 KB. If you resized the same image file using HTML, and displayed it as a 70 x 60 px thumbnail, it would still be 41 KB, when in reality it should be no more than 3 KB! Meaning 38 KB downloaded for nothing. The best solution is to resize images using software such as Photoshop, without using HTML. When content added by the website’s users has no specific added value, it is best to prevent them from being able to insert images using a WYSIWYG editor e.g. CKEditor.
rule_DontResizeImageInBrowser_DetailDesc.description: Do not resize image in browser

rule_DontResizeImageInBrowser_Comment.description: Number of image(s) resized in browser found

rule_DontResizeImageInBrowser_DetailComm.description: Image(s) resized from natural size to client size browser found

rule_EmptySrcTag_DetailDescription.message: If there is an image tag with an empty src attribute, the browser will call the directory in which the page is located, generating unnecessary, additional HTTP requests.

rule_EmptySrcTag_Comment.description: Number of  empty src tag(s) found

rule_ExternalizeCss_DetailDescription.message: Ensure that CSS files are separate from the page’s HTML code. If you include CSS in the body of the HTML file, and it is used for several pages (or even the whole website), then the code must be sent for each page requested by the user, therefore increasing the volume of data sent. However, if the CSS are in their own separate files, the browser can avoid requesting them again by storing them in its local cache.

rule_ExternalizeJs_DetailDescription.message: Ensure that JavaScript code is separate from the page’s HTML code, with the exception of any configuration variables for JavaScript objects. If you include JavaScript code in the body of the HTML file, and it is used for several pages (or even the whole website), then the code must be sent for each page requested by the user, therefore increasing the volume of data sent. However, if the JavaScript code is in his own separate file, the browser can avoid requesting them again by storing them in its local cache.

rule_HttpError_DetailDescription.message: Requests with HTTP errors consume resources unnecessarily.

rule_HttpRequests.message: Limit the number of HTTP requests (<27)
rule_HttpRequests.description: Limit the number of HTTP requests

rule_HttpRequests_DetailDescription.message: A page’s download time client-side directly correlates to the number and size of files the browser has to download. For each file, the browser sends a GET HTTP to the server. It waits for the response, and then downloads the resource as soon as it is available. Depending on the type of web server you use, the more requests per page there are, the fewer pages the server can handle. Reducing the number of requests per page is key to reducing the number of HTTP severs needed to run the website, and consequently its environmental impact
rule_HttpRequests_DetailDescription.description: Limit the number of HTTP requests

rule_ImageDownloadedNotDisplayed_DetailD.message: Downloading images that will not necessarily be visible consumes resources unnecessarily. For example, images that are displayed only after a user action.
rule_ImageDownloadedNotDisplayed_DetailD.description: Do not download image in browser until there are needed

rule_ImageDownloadedNotDisplayed_Comment.description: Number of image(s) downloaded but not displayed

rule_ImageDownloadedNotDisplayed_DetailC.description: Image(s) with size XxX is not display

rule_MaxCookiesLength_DetailDescription.message: Cookie length should be small as it is send with each request

rule_MaxCookiesLength_DetailComment.description: Cookie length x for domain y

rule_MinifiedCss_DetailDescription.message: Use a tool like YUI Compressor to remove unnecessary spaces and line breaks. Google’s Apache mod_pagespeed can also automate this operation.

rule_MinifiedJs_DetailDescription.message: Use a tool such as YUI Compressor to remove unnecessary white spaces, line breaks, semi-colons and shorten local variable names. This operation can be automated using Google’s Apache mod_pagespeed module.

rule_NoCookieForStaticRessources_DetailD.message: For static resources, a cookie is useless, so it consumes unnecessarily bandwidth.To avoid this, we can use a different domain for static resources or restrict the scope of cookies created

rule_NoCookieForStaticRessources_Comment.description: Number of static ressources with cookie

rule_NoRedirect_DetailDescription.message: Redirections should be avoided as much as possible as they slow down response and drain resources unnecessarily.

rule_OptimizeBitmapImages_DetailDescript.message: Bitmap images often constitute most of the bytes downloaded, just ahead of the CSS and JavaScript libraries. Optimizing them thus has a considerable impact on the bandwidth consumed.

rule_OptimizeBitmapImages_Comment.message: $NB_IMAGES$ image(s)shoud probably be optimize, minimum gain estimated: $MIN_GAINS$ KB

rule_OptimizeBitmapImages_DetailComment.description: Image x size, possible to gain yKB

rule_OptimizeSvg_DetailDescription.message: Svg images are less heavy than bitmap images, nevertheless they can be optimized and minified via tools (for example, svgo)

rule_Plugins_DetailDescription.message: Avoid using plugins (Flash Player, Java and Silverlight virtual machines, etc.) because they can be a heavy drain on resources (CPU and RAM). This is especially true with Adobe’s Flash Player, to such an extent that Apple decided to not install the technology on its mobile devices to maximize battery life. Favor standard technology such as HTML5 and ECMAScript

rule_PrintStyleSheet_DetailDescription.message: In addition to the benefits for the user, this style sheet reduces the number of pages printed, and therefore indirectly minimizes the website’s ecological footprint. It should be as streamlined as possible and employ an ink-light typeface e.g. Century Gothic. Also consider hiding the header, footer, menu and sidebar, as well as deleting all images except those needed for content.This print style sheet makes for a cleaner print by trimming down what is displayed on the screen.

rule_SocialNetworkButton.message: Do not use standarts social button
rule_SocialNetworkButton.description: Do not use standarts social button

rule_SocialNetworkButton_DetailDescripti.message: Social Network like Facebook , Twiter,Pinterest gives plugins to install on web page to get a share button and a like counter. These plugins consume unnecessary resources , it's better to put direct links
rule_SocialNetworkButton_DetailDescripti.description: Do not use standarts social button

rule_SocialNetworkButton_DefaultComment.message: No standart social network button found
rule_SocialNetworkButton_DefaultComment.description: No standart social network button found

rule_SocialNetworkButton_Comment.description: Number of standart social network button

rule_SocialNetworkButton_detailComment.message: A script from $SOCIAL_NETWORK$ has been found

rule_StyleSheets_DetailDescription.message: Minimize the number of CSS files to reduce the number of HTTP requests. If several style sheets are used on all of the website’s pages, concatenate them into one single file. Some CMS and frameworks offer ways to do such optimization automatically

rule_UseETags_DetailDescription.message: An ETag is a signature attached a server response. If the client requests a URL (HTML page, image, style sheet, etc.) whose ETag is identical to the one it already has, the web server will reply that it does not need to download the resource and that it should use the one it already possesses. Using ETags saves huge amounts of bandwidth.

rule_UseStandardTypefaces_DetailDescript.message: Use standard typefaces as they already exist on the user’s computer, and therefore do not need to be downloaded. This saves bandwidth and improves the website’s render time.

rule_JsValidate_DetailDescription.message: JSLint is a JavaScript code quality tool that checks that the JavaScript syntax used will be understood by all browsers. The code produced thus complies with coding rules which enables interpreters to quickly and easily run the code. The CPU is therefore utilized for a shorter time.

unsupportedRuleAnalyse.message: -- Analyse not supported by this browser --
unsupportedRuleAnalyse.description: Analyse not supported by this browser

rule_SetTimeout.message: Do not use String in SetTimeout Function
rule_SetTimeout.description: Do not use String in SetTimeout Function

rule_SetTimeout_DetailDescription.message: Avoid using String in SetTimeout Function
rule_SetTimeout_DetailDescription.description: Do not use string in SetTimeout

rule_InstantVisualChanges.message: Avoid fade in/fade out JavaScript effects in sliders
rule_InstantVisualChanges.description: Avoid fade in/fade out JavaScript effects in sliders

rule_InstantVisualChanges_DetailDescript.message: Avoid fade in/fade out JavaScript effects in sliders
rule_InstantVisualChanges_DetailDescript.description: Avoid fade in/fade out JavaScript effects in sliders

rule_InstantVisualChanges_Comment.description: Number of Instant Visual changes (fade in/fade out) found

rule_Flash_DetailDescription.message: Avoid using Flash (Flash Player, Java and Silverlight virtual machines, etc.) because they can be a heavy drain on resources (CPU and RAM). Favor standard technology such as HTML5 and ECMAScript

rule_CompressCSS.message: Limit the number and compress CSS files
rule_CompressCSS.description: Limit the number of CSS files and compress them

rule_CompressCSS_DetailDescription.message: Limit the number of CSS to avoid multiplying HTTP requests. If multiple style sheets are used on all pages of the site, concatenate them into a single file. It is also possible to configure the HTTP server to reduce the size of the style sheets by compressing them
rule_CompressCSS_DetailDescription.description: Limit the number and compress CSS files

rule_CompressCSS_DefaultComment.message: Limit the number and compress CSS files
rule_CompressCSS_DefaultComment.description: Limit the number and compress CSS files

rule_PrimitiveOperators.description: Avoid using methods for basic operations

rule_PrimitiveOperators_DetailDescriptio.description: Avoid using methods for basic operations

rule_PrimitiveOperators_DefaultComment.description: Avoid using methods for basic operations

rule_PrimitiveOperators_Comment.description: Avoid using methods for basic operations

rule_SingleQuotes.message: Use single quotes instead of double quotes
rule_SingleQuotes.description: Use single quotes instead of double quotes

rule_SingleQuotes_DetailDescription.message: Use single quotes instead of double quotes
rule_SingleQuotes_DetailDescription.description: Use single quotes instead of double quotes

rule_SingleQuotes_DefaultComment.message: Use single quotes instead of double quotes
rule_SingleQuotes_DefaultComment.description: Use single quotes instead of double quotes

rule_SingleQuotes_Comment.message: Use single quotes instead of double quotes
rule_SingleQuotes_Comment.description: Use single quotes instead of double quotes

rule_CacheFavicon_DetailDescription.message: The favicon.ico is the small image that is very often displayed in the address bar,next to the URL of the site. Not only must its weight be optimized, but it must be present in cache.

rule_CSSPrint_DetailDescription.message: In addition to the benefits for the user, this style sheet reduces the number of pages printed, and therefore indirectly minimizes the website’s ecological footprint. It should be as streamlined as possible and employ an ink-light typeface e.g. Century Gothic. Also consider hiding the header, footer, menu and sidebar, as well as deleting all images except those needed for content.This print style sheet makes for a cleaner print by trimming down what is displayed on the screen.

rule_AvoidForInLoop_DetailDescription.message: The loop for…In is more sophisticated than the basic loop, as it duplicates the elements of a list before starting the listing. It is therefore generally more costeffective to use a simple loop when the collection is well mastered.

rule_GetMethod.message: Use GET Method instead of POST Method

rule_GetMethod_DetailDescription.message: Use GET Method instead of POST Method
rule_GetMethod_DetailDescription.description: POST queries use two TCP connections (one for the header, the other for the data to be transferred), while HTTP queries in GET use only one. The latter therefore guarantee a saving in number of TCP connections.

rule_GetMethod_DefaultComment.message: Use GET Method instead of POST Method
rule_GetMethod_DefaultComment.description: Use GET Method instead of POST Method

rule_GetMethod_Comment.message: Use GET Method instead of POST Method
rule_GetMethod_Comment.description: Use GET Method instead of POST Method

rule_NoFunctionInFor.message: Do not call a function in the declaration of a for loop

rule_NoFunctionInFor_DetailDescription.message: Do not call a function in the declaration of a loop of type for, in order to avoid that the function is called at each iteration of the loop.
rule_NoFunctionInFor_DetailDescription.description: Do not call a function in the declaration of a loop of type for

rule_NoFunctionInFor_DefaultComment.message: No function found inside for loop
rule_NoFunctionInFor_DefaultComment.description: No function found inside for loop

rule_NoFunctionInFor_Comment.description: Do not call a function in the declaration of a loop of type for

rule_PromoteStaticPage_DetailDescription.message: Prefer static pages built outside the CMS. This will save CPU cycles, bandwidth, and electricity consumption.

rule_AbbreviatedCSS_DetailDescription.message: Use abbreviated CSS ratings to reduce the weight of the style sheet.

rule_SimilarCSS_DetailDescription.message: When several elements of the DOM (Document Object Model) have common CSS properties, report them together in the same style sheet. This method reduces the weight of the CSS.

rule_ExpensiveAnimations.message: Use will-change  to hints browsers how an element is expected to change
rule_ExpensiveAnimations.description: The will-change instruction lets the browser know that an animation it is able

rule_ExpensiveAnimations_DetailDescripti.message: Use will-change  to hints browsers how an element is expected to change
rule_ExpensiveAnimations_DetailDescripti.description: The will-change instruction lets the browser know that an animation it is able
